title: Enjoy polo? Head to Argentina to witness some sporting action
text:
An event brings out the best in a country and a sporty event sees loyalty and passion, when we combine the two it does get lethal. Argentina is in the spotlight this season as it gears up to host the international polo competition in November. The upcoming Winter Youth Olympics will attract several visitors to Norway who want to witness the championships live and explore the destination alongside. Fortunately, there is no shortage of activities to indulge in, sights to see, or places to shop at in Norway. The ultimate racing event Formula One in Brazil is a major attractions for enthusiasts.
While you're touring the country with this agenda, head out and discover yourself!
OPEN POLO 
Region : Argentina
Dates : November 21 - 12 December, 2015
The world fs best players, ponies and teams will converge in Buenos Aires and compete for the Argentine Triple Crown, comprised of the Campeonato Abierto del Tortugas Country Club, the 122nd Abiertos de Hurlingham and Palermo . the Argentine Open Polo Championship.
QUICK GETAWAYS (Near Buenos Aires) 
San Antonio de Arco: Magnificent estancias, nice rural lodges, cozy country hotels and picturesque little towns call to start the day with the fresh-baked smell of bread. The peaceful rural life invites to ride those elegant horses, go for a bike ride by their broad and cobblestone streets, visit traditional folk centres or interesting museums to be acquainted with the best native literature and the usages of the gauchos.
San Antonio is a pretty town and has been declared city of historic national interest by the Argentine Government. 
Tigre : Outside Buenos Aires is Tigre, a laidback weekend escape on an island in the Parana River Delta. The city of Tigre (35 kms north of Buenos Aires) and the surrounding delta region is a popular weekend getaway and can be easily reached by bus and train services. The town sits on an island created by several small streams and rivers. All along the shorelines are signs of water activities, from kayaking to wakeboarding, canoeing to sculling.

Head to the Municipal Museum of Art in Tigre, Argentina.
